intro: Chamaecytisus albus subsp. frivaldszkyanus, commonly known as the white broom subsp. Frivaldszkyanus, is a shrub native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and legume fruits. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its foliage is evergreen, with leathery, glossy leaves that provide year-round interest.
